results.abstract: As his stomach grew and the rest of his body got thinner, Hector Hernandez knew something was wrong, but he never suspected it was cancer.

multimedia.caption: At left, Hector Hernandez in July, a few days before the operation that removed a 77-pound tumor from his abdomen, and at right, a couple of weeks after the surgery.

results.title: That Virus Alert on Your Computer? Scammers in India May Be Behind It
results.abstract: The police outside New Delhi raided fake tech-support centers that sent false warnings to Americans and Canadians and then charged to “fix” the nonexistent infection.
results.byline: By VINDU GOEL and SUHASINI RAJ

multimedia.caption: A fake pop-up notice warning that a virus has infected a computer.

results.title: To Treat Eating Disorders, It Sometimes Takes Two
results.abstract: Romantic partners of someone with an eating disorder often want to help, but simply don’t know how.

multimedia.caption: Lauren and Brandon Hill prepare a lasagna dinner in their Wilmington, N.C., home; the couple now have a child, something they never could have imagined before Ms. Hill was treated for an eating disorder.
multimedia.copyright: Eamon Queeney for The New York Times
